member.name: T:Microsoft.Owin.Security.AuthenticationMode
member.summary: Controls the behavior of authentication middleware

member.name: F:Microsoft.Owin.Security.AuthenticationMode.Active
member.summary: In Active mode the authentication middleware will alter the user identity as the request arrives, and will also alter a plain 401 as the response leaves.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Owin.Security.AuthenticationMode.Passive
member.summary: In Passive mode the authentication middleware will only provide user identity when asked, and will only alter 401 responses where the authentication type named in the extra challenge data.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Owin.Security.AuthenticationOptions
member.summary: Base Options for all authentication middleware

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.AuthenticationOptions.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initialize properties of AuthenticationOptions base class
member.param: Assigned to the AuthenticationType property

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.AuthenticationOptions.AuthenticationType
member.summary: The AuthenticationType in the options corrisponds to the IIdentity AuthenticationType property. A different value may be assigned in order to use the same authentication middleware type more than once in a pipeline.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.AuthenticationOptions.AuthenticationMode
member.summary: If Active the authentication middleware alter the request user coming in and alter 401 Unauthorized responses going out. If Passive the authentication middleware will only provide identity and alter responses when explicitly indicated by the AuthenticationType.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.AuthenticationOptions.Description
member.summary: Additional information about the authentication type which is made available to the application.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Owin.Security.DataProtection.IDataProtectionProvider
member.summary: Factory used to create IDataProtection instances

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.DataProtection.IDataProtectionProvider.Create(System.String[])
member.summary: Returns a new instance of IDataProtection for the provider.
member.param: Additional entropy used to ensure protected data may only be unprotected for the correct purposes.
member.returns: An instance of a data protection service

member.name: T:Microsoft.Owin.Security.DataProtection.IDataProtector
member.summary: Service used to protect and unprotect data

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.DataProtection.IDataProtector.Protect(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Called to protect user data.
member.param: The original data that must be protected
member.returns: A different byte array that may be unprotected or altered only by software that has access to the an identical IDataProtection service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.DataProtection.IDataProtector.Unprotect(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Called to unprotect user data
member.param: The byte array returned by a call to Protect on an identical IDataProtection service.
member.returns: The byte array identical to the original userData passed to Protect.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Owin.Security.Infrastructure.AuthenticationHandler`1
member.summary: Base class for the per-request work performed by most authentication middleware.
member.typeparam: Specifies which type for of AuthenticationOptions property

member.name: T:Microsoft.Owin.Security.Infrastructure.AuthenticationHandler
member.summary: Base class for the per-request work performed by most authentication middleware.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.Infrastructure.AuthenticationHandler.Teardown
member.summary: Called once per request after Initialize and Invoke.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.Infrastructure.AuthenticationHandler.Invoke
member.summary: Called once by common code after initialization. If an authentication middleware responds directly to specifically known paths it must override this virtual, compare the request path to it's known paths, provide any response information as appropriate, and true to stop further processing.
member.returns: Returning false will cause the common code to call the next middleware in line. Returning true will cause the common code to begin the async completion journey without calling the rest of the middleware pipeline.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.Infrastructure.AuthenticationHandler.Authenticate
member.summary:
Causes the authentication logic in AuthenticateCore to be performed for the current request at most once and returns the results. Calling Authenticate more than once will always return the original value.
This method should always be called instead of calling AuthenticateCore directly.
member.returns: The ticket data provided by the authentication logic

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.Infrastructure.AuthenticationHandler.AuthenticateCore
member.summary: The core authentication logic which must be provided by the handler. Will be invoked at most once per requst. Do not call directly, call the wrapping Authenticate method instead.
member.returns: The ticket data provided by the authentication logic

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.Infrastructure.AuthenticationHandler.ApplyResponse
member.summary: Causes the ApplyResponseCore to be invoked at most once per request. This method will be invoked either earlier, when the response headers are sent as a result of a response write or flush, or later, as the last step when the original async call to the middleware is returning.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.Infrastructure.AuthenticationHandler.ApplyResponseCore
member.summary: Core method that may be overridden by handler. The default behavior is to call two common response activities, one that deals with sign-in/sign-out concerns, and a second to deal with 401 challenges.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.Infrastructure.AuthenticationHandler.ApplyResponseGrant
member.summary: Override this method to dela with sign-in/sign-out concerns, if an authentication scheme in question deals with grant/revoke as part of it's request flow. (like setting/deleting cookies)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.Infrastructure.AuthenticationHandler.ApplyResponseChallenge
member.summary: Override this method to dela with 401 challenge concerns, if an authentication scheme in question deals an authentication interaction as part of it's request flow. (like adding a response header, or changing the 401 result to 302 of a login page or external sign-in location.)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.Infrastructure.AuthenticationHandler`1.Initialize(`0,Microsoft.Owin.OwinRequest,Microsoft.Owin.OwinResponse)
member.summary: Initialize is called once per request to contextualize this instance with appropriate state.
member.param: The original options passed by the application control behavior
The utility object to observe the current request
The utility object to effect the current response

member.name: T:Microsoft.Owin.Security.PinnedCertificateValidator
member.summary: Provides pinned certificate validation, which checks HTTPS communication against a known good list of certificates to protect against compromised or rogue CAs issuing certificates for hosts without the knowledge of the host owner.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.PinnedCertificateValidator.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.String})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A HashSet of thumbprints which are valid for an HTTPS request.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.PinnedCertificateValidator.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.String})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A HashSet of thumbprints which are valid for an HTTPS request.
A HashSet of thumbprints which are invalid for an HTTPS request.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.PinnedCertificateValidator.RemoteCertificateValidationCallbackValidator(System.Object,System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate,System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Chain,System.Net.Security.SslPolicyErrors)
member.summary: Validates that the certificate presented and its signing chain is not contained in the and is contained in the .
member.param: An object that contains state information for this validation.
The certificate used to authenticate the remote party.
The chain of certificate authorities associated with the remote certificate.
One or more errors associated with the remote certificate.
member.returns: A Boolean value that determines whether the specified certificate is accepted for authentication.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.PinnedCertificateValidator.ValidCertificateThumbprints
member.summary: Gets or sets the valid thumbprints for back channel authentication.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.PinnedCertificateValidator.InvalidCertificateThumbprints
member.summary: Gets or sets the invalid thumbprints for back channel authentication.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.PinnedCertificateValidator.RemoteCertificateValidationCallback
member.summary: Gets the remote certificate validation callback.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Owin.Security.DataProtection.DpapiDataProtectionProvider
member.summary: Used to provide the data protection services that are derived from the Data Protection API. It is the best choice of data protection when you application is not hosted by ASP.NET and all processes are running as the same domain identity.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.DataProtection.DpapiDataProtectionProvider.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new DpapiDataProtectionProvider with a random application name. This is only useful to protect data for the duration of the current application execution.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.DataProtection.DpapiDataProtectionProvider.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new DpapiDataProtectionProvider which uses the given appName as part of the protection algorithm
member.param: A user provided value needed to round-trip secured data. The default value comes from the IAppBuilder.Properties["owin.AppName"] when self-hosted.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Owin.Security.DataProtection.DpapiDataProtectionProvider.Create(System.String[])
member.summary: Returns a new instance of IDataProtection for the provider.
member.param: Additional entropy used to ensure protected data may only be unprotected for the correct purposes.
member.returns: An instance of a data protection service

The authentication mode the middleware is running under

member.name: T:Microsoft.Owin.Security.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.Resources.Exception_DefaultDpapiRequiresAppNameKey
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The default data protection provider may only be used when the IAppBuilder.Properties contains an appropriate 'host.AppName' key..

member.name: P:Microsoft.Owin.Security.Resources.Exception_UnhookAuthenticationStateType
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The state passed to UnhookAuthentication may only be the return value from HookAuthentication..
